meanings.definition: In a pleasing or melodious manner.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirped euphoniously in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She sang euphoniously during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The wind whispered euphoniously through the trees.
meanings.sent4: The stream flowed euphoniously over the smooth rocks.
meanings.sent5: The bells rang euphoniously, filling the air with joy.

meanings.sent1: The euphoniously played piano soothed her nerves.
meanings.sent2: The euphoniously tuned guitar resonated throughout the room.
meanings.sent3: The euphoniously purring cat curled up on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The euphoniously flowing fountain added charm to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The euphoniously singing choir captivated the audience.
